questions.questionText: What is an annotation in Java?
questions.correctAnswer: A special kind of metadata used to provide information to the compiler or IDE.
questions.explanation:
An annotation in Java is a form of metadata that provides additional information about code without changing its actual logic.

• Purpose
Annotations are mainly used to give instructions to the compiler, development tools, or runtime frameworks.

• Usage
They begin with the @ symbol and can be applied to classes, methods, variables, parameters, and more.

• Benefits
Annotations help reduce boilerplate code, improve readability, and enable powerful features such as code generation, validation, and dependency injection.

• Examples of use cases
Common uses include marking deprecated code, overriding methods, configuring frameworks, and enabling compile-time or runtime checks.
